citations.narrative:
On April 3, 2025, one male Indian ringneck (rose-ringed parakeet) was found deceased in his enclosure after becoming
entrapped in the wire feeder station. According to the licensee, the bowl used in the feeder was likely the wrong size
which allowed the bird to push his head through an opening between the wire and the bowl but did not allow him to get
back out.
Enclosure design that allows birds to become entangled or entrapped can lead to stress, injury, or death. The licensee
must ensure that primary enclosures are constructed and maintained so that they protect the birds from injury.
To be corrected from this day, April 29, 2025, forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(ii)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
On April 3, 2025, one male Indian ringneck (rose-ringed parakeet) was found deceased in his enclosure after becoming 
entrapped in the wire feeder station. According to the licensee, the bowl used in the feeder was likely the wrong size 
which allowed the bird to push his head through an opening between the wire and the bowl but did not allow him to get 
back out.  
Enclosure design that allows birds to become entangled or entrapped can lead to stress, injury, or death. The licensee 
must ensure that primary enclosures are constructed and maintained so that they protect the birds from injury. 
To be corrected from this day, April 29, 2025, forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
